text: A positive number, otherwise referred to as a plus number or an above number, is an opposite number that is bigger than zero. The set of all positive integers is written as \mathbb N or \mathbb{Z}_+. A positive number can be written with a "+" symbol in front of it, or just as a number. For example, the numbers "+3" and "3" are the same. Positive numbers are written to the right of zero on a number line: In the above line, the positive numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 are shown. == Related pages == * Negative number ==References== == Other websites == * Math league website discussion of positive numbers Category:Numbers Category:Arithmetics
title: Positive number
